node.text: If you deny climate change, what else do you deny? Science has changed your life for the better, so I don't understand what the issue is!

node.title: A Message To All Climate Change Deniers

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by @climatebriefings on August 17, 2021 tagging @lakotalaw. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'Water cuts are coming to Arizona and Nevada after the US declared the first-ever Colorado River water shortage Morgan McFall-Johnsen Aug 16, 2021, 9:38 PM f'.

node.text:
From @lakotalaw 🌍🔥✊❤️
・・・
For the first time ever, the US federal government has declared a water shortage on the Colorado River.

That's because Lake Mead, the nation's largest reservoir, is lower than it's ever been. It provides water to 25 million people across Arizona, Nevada, California, and Mexico, but as of Monday it's at just 1,067 feet above sea level — about 35% full.

The federal water-shortage declaration means that Arizona and Nevada will face mandatory water cut-backs in January. The cuts will mostly affect farmers in Arizona; the state will lose about one-fifth of the water it normally gets from the river, according to The Associated Press.

"It's very significant," Brad Udall, senior water and climate scientist at Colorado State University, told CNN. "It's something that those of us in the climate community have been worried about for over a decade, based on declining flows due to climate change." From @mniwiconi
・・・

node.text:
Every day we wait, we make things irreversibly worse. From @climatehuman 🌍🔥✊❤️

@climatebriefings

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by @climatebriefings on August 11, 2021 tagging @wordsfromablackwoman. May be an image of text.

node.text:
From @wordsfromablackwoman 🌍🔥✊❤️
・・・
Ignoring climate change will undo our Social Justice work. 

Climate change is one of the most urgent crises we face today. Yes, there are a lot of other things going down, but if we don’t swiftly address how we tackle climate change, there may be no point of fighting for social change as we may not have a planet well enough to see the fruits of our activism labour.

The result of climate change impacts certain pockets of society more than others. I’m in one of those pockets. 

Corporate greed has drastically accelerated the devastation that climate change brings. Natural disasters are becoming the norm, and let’s face it; we aren’t ever going to win against Mother Nature. 

I’ve recently become a Patron of @jo_lorenz (AWESOME WOMAN) and this week I got involved in a Q&A about Climate Change. 

I talk about this in my latest article plus what we can all do now. 

Swipe left for the cheat sheet ⏩⏩⏩

Link in bio 💚

#LetsTalkAboutSociety #SelfReflectionSunday #BlackSolidarity
#LetsTalkAboutRacism #UnityandSupport
#BlackLivesMatter #BLM #QualityTime #Racism #RacismInSociety #Inequality #Injustice #BlackVoices 
#WordsFromABlackWoman #Blog #FightingForChange #Unity #BlackAuthor #Equality #AntiRacism #Education
#ClimateChange #SocialJustice

Photo by @climatebriefings on August 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Global temperature change (1850-2019) 1860 1890 1890 1920 1950 1980 2010'.

node.text:
From @gretathunberg 🌍🔥✊❤️
・・・
The new IPCC report contains no real surprises. It confirms what we already know from thousands previous studies and reports - that we are in an emergency. It’s a solid (but cautious) summary of the current best available science.

It doesn't tell us what to do. It is up to us to be brave and take decisions based on the scientific evidence provided in these reports. We can still avoid the worst consequences, but not if we continue like today, and not without treating the crisis like a crisis.
Graph by World Meteorological Organization.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by @climatebriefings on August 08, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Kate Marvel @DrKateMarvel The IPCC report is coming out tomorrow. As a climate scientist, I'd like don't have hope. you to know: have something better: certainty. We know exactly what's causing climate change. We can absolutely 1) avoid the worst and 2) build a better world in the process.'.

node.text:
Be prepared to be inundated by stories about the new @ipcc report all week and then everyone will just pretend like everything’s ok again. 🌍🔥✊❤️
*
*
*
@climatebriefings

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by @climatebriefings on August 07, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Dr. Jessica McCarty @jmccarty_geo At a NASA Earth meeting 10 years ago, a white male post doc interrupted me to tell me that didn't understand human drivers of fire, that I def needed to read McCarty et al. Looked him in the eye, pulled my long hair back so he could read my name tag. "I'm McCarty et al."'.
